bug.summary: Import Error: Cannot load backend 'TkAgg' which requires the 'tk' interactive framework, as 'headless' is currently running
bug.description:
I'm facing import error while executing the ludwig from google colab.. !! Below is the code which I executed in steps:
Loading Ludwig !pip install ludwig
Upload file from local to Drive - to use in Colab from google.colab import files uploaded = files.upload()
Train DataSet using ludwig cmd !ludwig train --data_csv ludwig_traindataset_1.csv --model_definition_file model_def.yaml
My model_def.yaml <denchmark-code>input_features: - name: utterance type: sequence encoder: rnn cell_type: lstm bidirectional: true num_layers: 2 reduce_output: None
output_features: - name: intent type: category reduce_input: sum num_fc_layers: 1 fc_size: 64 - name: slots type: sequence decoder: tagger </denchmark-code>
Dummy Dataset: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5066436/52621497-72296680-2ecd-11e9-90cb-81240aa4c6bc.png></denchmark-link>
Attached the screenshot error: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5066436/52621405-31315200-2ecd-11e9-801f-346acefb1cf4.png></denchmark-link>
Can anyone help me on this in Google Colab GPU / Python 3.6

comments.comment: So it turns out mpl.use('TKAgg') was needed to render windows in Mac OS X in older versions of matplotlib. I removed it and increased the matplotlib version in the requirements. Please confirm this solves the issue.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/w4nderlust>@w4nderlust</denchmark-link> pip is pulling only the old release version not newer one. :( because the error is still throwing which points to older code.

Yes I will update to version 0.1.1 once enough bugs are fixed. In the mean time can you please try with pip install https://github.com/uber/ludwig/archive/master.zip which should install the current code in the master branch?

That is likely a problem with your data. Lookin at the screenshot you posted, you are escaping commas that separate columns, you should not do that, you should only escape commas if you have them inside strings. Closing this as the original issue is solved, let me know if fixing the dataset doesn't solve the problem.
What solved the problem for me was to restart my kernel, import the following first: import matplotlib matplotlib.use('TKAgg') Then, import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

What solved the problem for me was to restart my kernel, import the following first: <denchmark-code>import matplotlib matplotlib.use('TKAgg')
</denchmark-code>
Then, import matplotlib.pyplot as plt You probably imported matplotlib with another framework before you tried to change to TKAgg.
